## Portfolio Beta and Cost of Capital A two-asset portfolio invests **33**% in Asset A (β = 0.79) and **67**% in Asset B (β = 0.97). Compute the **portfolio beta**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ **Aggregation rule:** Portfolio beta is the **value-weighted average** of component betas: βp = Σ wiβi. **Your numbers:** 33%×0.79 + 67%×0.97 (scaled to weights) → **0.911**.
::: With **Rf = 2.2**% and **Rm = 8.1**%, compute the portfolio’s **cost of capital via CAPM**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ **CAPM logic:** Required return rises with **systematic risk** (β). E[Rp] = Rf + βp(Rm − Rf) = **7.57%**. Interpretation: this is the portfolio’s **opportunity cost of capital**.
:::
